Robert Greer
President at ARMS Medical
February 22, 2016, Michel managed Robert directly

Rob is a born winner who will stop at nothing to accomplish his goals.  As a sales executive he leads by example both on the front lines and in the office.  He has demonstrated how to motivate his team to get each member to perform at their peak potential.  He is quick to learn and open to change when put into a new environment.  He is a tremendous asset to a sales leadership team. During his relatively short time at getAbstract, Inc. he was able to reenergize and stabilize the West region, while adding over 30% new client revenue. I look forward to the opportunity to work with him again.

summary: Michel is an advisor to companies. He is a senior operator and entrepreneur with a mix of small business and corporate successes in a global capacity.  He is a servant leader focused on growing companies by driving new go-to-market strategies and elevating teams to perform their best.As CEO & Founder of 2Swell, he and his team are committed to helping entrepreneurs and small/mid-size companies reach their next level of success.  2Swell advises senior executives on strategy, while leveraging their internal teams to drive the execution of plans that increase ROI of existing resources and new opportunities of growth.Prior to leading 2Swell, Michel was the chief executive officer at getAbstract Inc. a leading online media company, where he was able to transform the enterprise from small to mid-size, driving 270% growth  in North America, Latin America and a number of emerging markets over 5 years.Previously, Michel held a number of senior sales, marketing and business development positions at Citrix Systems where he built many of the firm’s most strategic go-to-market, revenue-generating alliances and channel partnerships - generating over $100 million in revenue annually. Prior to Michel’s roles at Citrix, he held business development and consulting positions at Baan Company (now Infor). He also worked at Morgan Stanley and International Distillers (now Diageo). Michel sat on the board of the Make-a-Wish Foundation of Southern Florida, held a seat as board member at the software division of the Software & Information Industry Association and at the Dutch Chamber of Commerce in Miami. He won two alliance excellence awards from the Association of Strategic Alliances Professionals. Michel been published and mentioned in over 50 articles in places like The Washington Post, Strategy Magazine, Fast Company, Miami Herald, Forbes.com and others.He currently resides in North Miami Beach, with his wife and two children.
name: Michel Koopman
title: Helping Companies and Leaders Grow and be Great
